thread.title: Trump Will Keep His Thoughts To Himself On Upcoming Major Event
thread.title_full: Trump Will Keep His Thoughts To Himself On Upcoming Major Event

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Will Keep His Thoughts To Himself On Upcoming Major Event
text:
Trump Will Keep His Thoughts To Himself On Upcoming Major Event "... respectfully declined ..." Advertisement - story continues below 
March Madness will be a little less presidential this year. 
President Donald Trump will not continue former President Barack Obama’s practice of picking brackets for the NCAA men’s and women’s college basketball tournaments that will begin next month. 
“We expressed our interest to the White House in continuing the presidential bracket. They have respectfully declined,” ESPN said in a statement. Advertisement - story continues below 
White House spokesman Hope Hicks, in an email to The Washington Post, did not rule out a later venture with the network. 
“We look forward to working with ESPN on another opportunity in the near future,” she wrote. 
ESPN’s Andy Katz said, “The bracket idea worked because President Obama follows basketball and is passionate about the sport.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Twitter, always amused by all things Trump, had something to say about Trump’s refusal to follow the precedent Obama had established. Trump didn't fill out a NCAA bracket because he has more important things to do…. like golf. 
— Jeff Dye (@JeffDye) February 15, 2017 Donald Trump says he will not fill out NCAA tournament bracket which is unfortunate since Trump University is a favorite to make Sweet 16 
— Troy Hughes™ (@TommySledge) February 15, 2017 Thinking March Madness might be more about the Trump administration and not NCAA basketball. 
— Meg Lessard (@Members_Lounge) February 15, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
